stars.name: Sun
stars.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma, with internal convective motion that generates a magnetic field via a dynamo process. The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star and comprises about 99.86% of the mass of the Solar System.

stars.name: Proxima Centauri
stars.description: Proxima Centauri is the closest known star to the Sun. It is a red dwarf star located in the constellation of Centaurus.

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.description: Betelgeuse is one of the largest stars known. It is a red supergiant star in the constellation of Orion and is expected to go supernova in the future.

stars.name: Sirius
stars.description: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky. It is a binary star system consisting of a main-sequence star (Sirius A) and a white dwarf (Sirius B).

stars.name: Alpha Centauri
stars.description: Alpha Centauri is a binary star system that is the closest known star system to the Solar System. It consists of three stars: Alpha Centauri A, Alpha Centauri B, and Proxima Centauri.

stars.name: Vega
stars.description: Vega is the brightest star in the constellation of Lyra. It is an A-type main-sequence star and one of the most studied stars outside the Solar System.

stars.name: Polaris
stars.description: Polaris, also known as the North Star, is a Cepheid variable star located close to the north celestial pole. It has been used for navigation for centuries.

stars.name: Antares
stars.description: Antares is a red supergiant star in the constellation of Scorpius. It is one of the brightest stars in the nighttime sky and appears reddish in color.

stars.name: Rigel
stars.description: Rigel is the brightest star in the constellation of Orion. It is a blue-white B-type main-sequence star and one of the most luminous stars known.

stars.name: Deneb
stars.description: Deneb is one of the brightest stars in the constellation of Cygnus. It is an A-type supergiant star and is part of the Northern Cross asterism.

stars.name: Altair
stars.description: Altair is one of the stars that form the Summer Triangle. It is an A-type main-sequence star located in the constellation of Aquila.
